intro: Capitanopsis cloiselii, commonly known as the Cape mountain daisy, is a perennial shrub native to the Western Cape region of South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its dense, compact growth habit and showy, yellow-orange composite flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils and is adapted to the Mediterranean climate of its native habitat. Its foliage consists of narrow, leathery leaves that are often covered in a fine layer of white wax. Capitanopsis cloiselii is often cultivated in gardens for its ornamental value and drought tolerance.
